content:
advertisement

The road is only going to get tougher for the Penn State mens and womens fencing teams PERIOD

Aside from their early trip to Kansas City in November the fencers have remained remotely close to home PERIOD They hosted the Garret Penn State Open and then later traveled to Pittsburgh for another open invitational PERIOD

Now the heavy packing and traveling has begun for some of the defending national champions PERIOD After a long and vigorous threeday tournament this past weekend in Budapest Hungary members of the team will be traveling all over the country for the next two months PERIOD

Their stops will include San Jose Calif. for an Olympic Trial North Carolina for a team meet and Memphis Tenn. for another Junior Olympic event PERIOD

In between the flights to San Jose and North Carolina the team will be able to recover at home for a couple of days PERIOD

However it will not be getting much rest as head coach Emmanuil Kaidanov will be preparing his team for a meet at home against Drew North Carolina Haverford Johns Hopkins and Penn PERIOD

 Kaidanov said PERIOD

If the Nittany Lions are going to defend their national championship their play will have to improve away from home especially from their key players PERIOD

Last weekend in Hungary two of the mens top fencers did not finish as well as Kaidanov expected PERIOD The tournament was a chance for the three fencers that were invited to promote themselves for the Junior Olympic team PERIOD

Sophomore saber Aleksander Ochocki went  in the preliminary rounds but only finished in the top32 after a close loss that would have had Ochocki in the top16 PERIOD Kaidanov said his sophomore captain fenced pretty well but could have done better PERIOD

Another low spot was freshman foil David Willette PERIOD Willette who has fenced with much poise this season did not perform well on the big stage PERIOD After a great showing in Kansas City Mo. earlier in the season he went  and was not able to crack the top32 PERIOD

 Kaidanov said of the freshman PERIOD

Despite the disappointment from Kaidanov there was something that came out of Hungary to look forward to PERIOD

Freshman foil Daniel GomezTanamachi who hails from Mexico City went  in the preliminary round and ended up finishing in nineteenth place PERIOD

Kaidanov said GomezTanamachi lost in the crucial moments of his last bout because of an  Kaidanov declined to comment any further on what specifically happened in the match PERIOD

 Kaidanov said PERIOD 

GomezTanamachi remained the No PERIOD  overall mens fencer to represent Mexico in the Junior World Cup PERIOD

The freshman was very happy with his performance but also felt he could have done better PERIOD

 GomezTanamachi said PERIOD
